summary: A guitar tutorial for 'Stitches' by Shawn Mendes, focusing on chord and strumming patterns.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen displaying the title "Stitches" in orange text, followed by the name "Shawn Mendes" in smaller orange text below it. The scene then transitions to a black background with the words "Song Structure" in orange at the top, followed by a list of song components in white text: "Verse," "Pre-Chorus," "Chorus," "Verse," "Pre-Chorus," "Chorus," "Bridge," "Chorus," and "Outro." The video maintains this layout, emphasizing the song structure of "Stitches" by Shawn Mendes, with no additional visual elements or changes in the background.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with one male speaker introducing the song "Stitches" by Shawn Mendes. He then passes the speaking role to another male speaker, who says they will "start with the song structure". The first male speaker then returns, outlining the song structure as "verse, pre-chorus, chorus", followed by another repetition of that section, then a bridge, a chorus, and an outro. He notes this structure is basic and common in modern songs, being the most popular song structure today.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a title screen displaying "Guitar Parts" in orange text on a black background, listing four sections: Verse (1:55), Pre-Chorus (3:41), Chorus (5:27), and Bridge (7:18). This is followed by another screen with the text "Check The Description" in orange, accompanied by "Chords + Lyrics + Techniques" and an orange arrow pointing downwards, suggesting viewers look for additional information in the video description. The scene then transitions to a close-up of a person playing an acoustic guitar, focusing on the fretboard and the person's hand strumming the strings. The individual is wearing a black shirt and blue jeans, with a white background emphasizing the guitar and the player's actions. The video then shifts to a medium shot of the same person, now standing against the white background, gesturing with their hands as if explaining or discussing something. The person's facial expressions and hand movements suggest they are engaged in a conversation or presentation, likely related to the guitar playing or music techniques. The video maintains a clean and simple aesthetic, with the white background keeping the focus on the person and the guitar.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with an explanation of how to break a song into guitar parts: verse, pre-chorus, chorus, and bridge. A male speaker continues by saying, "we're using the same four chords for the entire song just in different orders", then invites the listener to check out a link for lyrics and chords. He gives a directive to tune up and put a capo on the first fret. The man says he'd appreciate "a thumbs up or a comment" as motivation for "making more videos".

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black V-neck T-shirt, standing against a plain white background. He appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change. The scene then transitions to a slide titled "Song Structure," which lists the components of a typical song: Verse, Pre-Chorus, Chorus, Bridge, and Outro. The slide also includes a section labeled "Verse" with lyrics that read, "I thought that I've been hurt before, But no one's ever left me quite this sore, Your words cut deeper than a knife, Now I need someone to breathe me back to life." Following this, the video shows a close-up of a person playing an acoustic guitar, with the chords Am, G, C, and F displayed at the bottom of the screen. The person's hands are positioned on the fretboard and strumming the strings, indicating they are playing a song. The background remains plain and white throughout the video, maintaining a simple and focused atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker encouraging listeners to subscribe to access his latest content. This spoken segment transitions to a strummed acoustic guitar, playing a simple, repetitive chord progression, suggesting an upbeat mood.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person playing an acoustic guitar, dressed in a black shirt and blue jeans, against a plain white background. The focus is on the hands and the guitar, with the person's left hand forming chords on the fretboard and the right hand strumming the strings. The video includes instructional elements, such as chord diagrams for Am, G, C, and F, displayed at the bottom of the screen. The chords are labeled with their respective names and finger positions, accompanied by a rhythmic guide indicating the strumming pattern. The video also includes a section on song structure, listing the typical sections of a song, such as Verse, Pre-Chorus, Chorus, Bridge, and Outro. Additionally, there is a Pre-Chorus section with lyrics displayed, providing context for the song being played. The video maintains a clean and instructional atmosphere, with a focus on teaching guitar playing techniques and song structure.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with the distinct sound of a stringed instrument, most likely a guitar, playing chords. A male voice then enters, introducing the chords being played as A minor, G, C, and F. The male speaker then guides the listener through playing the verse of a song, clarifying "this isn't too complicated," involving playing "on the one and the and on beat one" and "beats two to four...just playing on the and", playing each chord for one bar. The male narrator provides counting examples like "one and two", explaining the rhythmic pattern, before re-demonstrating the song progression with guitar. The male narrator concludes, stating, "that's all there is to it", and the sound of the guitar playing the song progression repeats.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person playing an acoustic guitar, dressed in a black shirt and blue jeans, against a plain white background. The focus is on the hands and the guitar, with the person's left hand pressing down on the fretboard and the right hand strumming the strings. Throughout the video, chord diagrams appear at the bottom of the screen, indicating the chords being played, such as F, G, and Am. The diagrams show the finger positions on the fretboard for each chord, with numbers representing the fingers used. The video provides a clear and instructional view of the guitar playing technique, with the person demonstrating the strumming and finger placement for each chord. The overall atmosphere is simple and focused, with the emphasis on the guitar playing and the instructional content.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker introducing a "pre-chorus". He then states the chord progression, which consists of "F," "G," "A minor," and "G," followed by a brief pause. The sound of an acoustic guitar playing each of these chords can be heard as the speaker announces them.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person playing an acoustic guitar, focusing on their hands and the instrument. The individual is wearing a black shirt and blue jeans, and the guitar has a natural wood finish with a visible sound hole and fretboard. The person's left hand is positioned on the fretboard, pressing down on the strings to form chords, while the right hand strums the strings. The background is plain white, emphasizing the guitar and the player's hands. On-screen text displays chord names (F, G, Am, G) and a rhythmic pattern (1, &, 2, &, 3, &, 4, &), indicating the sequence of chords and strumming beats. The video transitions to a screen with song structure and lyrics, with the left side listing sections like Verse, Pre-Chorus, Chorus, Bridge, and Outro, and the right side displaying the lyrics for the Chorus section. The text is in orange and white against a dark background, providing a clear contrast for readability. The lyrics describe emotional themes of pain, longing, and desperation, with phrases like "You watch me bleed until I can't breathe" and "Begging you to come help." The video maintains a consistent focus on the guitar playing and the song structure, offering a comprehensive guide to the song's composition and lyrics.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker explaining a guitar part, specifying a rhythm pattern involving playing "on the one and the two" followed by "three and four and" with chord changes. He then demonstrates the described guitar playing.  Next, he concludes with the statement "that's all there is to it." Then, more of the guitar playing is heard,  shifting into a music excerpt of a singer playing acoustic guitar with a somber tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person playing an acoustic guitar, dressed in a black shirt and blue jeans, against a plain white background. The focus is on the hands and the guitar, with the person's left hand forming chords on the fretboard and the right hand strumming the strings. The video includes instructional elements, such as chord diagrams for Am, G, C, and F, and a tablature guide for playing the chords in sequence. The tablature shows the rhythm pattern for each chord, with arrows indicating the strumming direction and timing. The video also includes a section on song structure, listing the typical sections of a song, such as Verse, Pre-Chorus, Chorus, Bridge, and Outro. Additionally, the lyrics for the Bridge section of the song are displayed, featuring the repeated line "Needle and the thread, gotta get you out of my head." The video serves as a tutorial for playing a specific song, providing both visual and textual guidance for the viewer.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a single speaker, male, who transitions into discussing music. The speaker identifies the sections of a song, mentioning chords such as "A minor", "G", "C", and "F", and describes the rhythm as playing "on the one, two and the end of three, then four and". He demonstrates the chord progression in sequence. The clip concludes with music being played, presumably on a guitar, that exhibits a light and rhythmic folk style.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a person playing an acoustic guitar, dressed in a black shirt and blue jeans, against a plain white background. The focus is on the hands and the guitar, with the person's left hand forming chords on the fretboard and the right hand strumming the strings. The video includes instructional elements, such as chord diagrams for Am, G, C, and F chords, displayed at the bottom of the screen. Additionally, there are arrows and numbers indicating the strumming pattern, with the text "Am G C F" and "1 & 2 & 3 & 4 &" providing guidance on the rhythm. The person demonstrates the chord changes and strumming sequence, emphasizing the instructional nature of the video. The overall atmosphere is simple and focused, with the instructional text and visual aids enhancing the learning experience for viewers.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker introducing the bridge of a song. He mentions the chord progression and explains a palm-muting technique. He describes what palm-muting is, where on the guitar to place the palm, and its effect on the sound. He demonstrates this technique, playing the chords one by one, advising that it may take some practice. The speaker then states that if one can play the four parts, one can play the entire song and asks if the listener enjoyed the video. There is brief acoustic guitar music at the start and interspersed with his speech.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing a black V-neck T-shirt standing against a plain white background. He is seen making various hand gestures, including pointing to himself and making a fist, while speaking. The man's facial expressions change throughout the video, indicating that he is engaged in a conversation or presentation. The background remains consistent and uncluttered, keeping the focus on the man and his actions. There are no visible objects or text in the video, and the atmosphere is simple and straightforward, emphasizing the man's communication.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker starts by giving a command, suggesting the listener subscribe to a channel for immediate access to content updates. After suggesting the subscription, the speaker directs the listener to click on either of two video options to begin their "next guitar adventure".
